summary: Senior DevSecOps and Software Engineer with over 10 years of experience supporting federal and public sector initiatives. Skilled in backend development, secure CI/CD automation, and multi-cloud infrastructure across AWS, Azure, and GCP.

bio: I’m a Software Engineer & DevSecOps Engineer with over 10 years of experience specializing in scalable backend systems and secure software delivery.
My focus is on building modern CI/CD pipelines that automate builds, enforce security scanning, run automated testing, and enable fast and reliable deployments.
Over the years, I’ve engineered complete applications and multi-cloud infrastructure migrations to AWS, Azure, GCP, and Oracle Cloud, always prioritizing reliability and zero downtime.
Technology moves fast — I stay ahead by quickly mastering new frameworks, tools, and cloud platforms to support evolving program needs.
personal_interests: Watching and attending MLB games — especially the Los Angeles Dodgers at Dodger Stadium.
Following high-stakes soccer matches, cheering for Mexico and the United States.
Spending quality time with family, including Disneyland trips and travel to new places around the world.

responsibilities: Lead secure software delivery initiatives for multiple enterprise applications by designing and improving CI/CD pipelines with GitHub Actions.
Integrated automated code scanning, container security, and SAST tools including Fortify, SonarQube, and Trivy to enforce DevSecOps best practices.
Partner with engineering and product teams to modernize applications and support future AI expansion within the agency.
Developed a multilingual translator application using C# and Azure Cognitive Services to support accessibility and global engagement.
Contribute to strategic efforts that expand cloud adoption, improve operational reliability, and scale platforms across AWS and Azure services.
Provide guidance and hands-on engineering to ensure secure deployment workflows and automation standards across the organization.

experience.company: Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts (Guidehouse)
responsibilities: Automated CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins and integrated security throughout the SDLC.
Managed container deployments using Docker and Kubernetes on OpenShift.
Used ArgoCD and GitLab for GitOps delivery across environments.
Led a cloud-migration POC using Terraform across AWS, Azure, GCP, and OCI.
Designed and deployed microservices with .NET Core and Docker in Kubernetes.
Implemented automated unit testing and peer code review processes.
Developed secure APIs and backend services with .NET, React, and React Native.
Managed deployment pipelines to ensure synchronized staging and production environments.
Built internal reporting tools using C#, SharePoint, and AngularJS.
Integrated dynamic data with Web Services.
Maintained and enhanced systems for law enforcement and county offices using Java, C#, and PHP.

education.institution: University of Texas at El Paso
University of Texas at El Paso

certifications: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner — Issued June 2025

projects.name: Infrastructure as Code (AWS Platform)
projects.description: Automated deployment of a secure, scalable AWS platform that hosts the portfolio ecosystem. Modular Terraform architecture enabling consistent environments, CI/CD automation, and global content delivery.
projects.impact: Zero-manual deployment infrastructure that supports production traffic and future scalability.
features: CloudFront CDN with HTTPS & Route 53 DNS
Serverless API hosting via Lambda + API Gateway

projects.name: React AI Portfolio
projects.description: Modern, responsive portfolio with a bilingual AI Chat Assistant that answers career questions based on verified structured data. Fully serverless and globally distributed through CloudFront.
projects.impact: Increases engagement from recruiters and hiring managers through conversational exploration of experience.

projects.name: Portfolio API (Python Serverless)
projects.description: FastAPI serverless microservice that powers the AI assistant with structured responses. Deployed to AWS Lambda with OpenAPI documentation, automated testing, and vulnerability scanning.
projects.impact: Ensures correctness, consistency, and security of all AI-provided career information.

projects.name: Grant Management React App
projects.description: CRUD grant management tool showcasing modern React components integrated with the Portfolio API backend. Deployed via CI/CD with security checks.
projects.impact: Demonstrates production-ready frontend and backend interaction patterns.
features: Static code analysis with CI enforcement

projects.name: DevSecOps PoC (EPCC Showcase)
projects.description: Educational DevSecOps environment demonstrating CI/CD, containerization, and Kubernetes operations used to train students on modern software delivery.
projects.impact: Helped engineering students gain real-world DevSecOps exposure.
projects.context: Built as voluntary work for EPCC to support student learning.

projects.name: Trenzando Corazones Mobile App (Cancer Survivor)
projects.description: A bilingual mobile application (Spanish-focused) designed to support the annual 'Trenzando Corazones' charity event, where participants donated ponytails to benefit individuals fighting cancer. The application enabled dynamic questionnaire creation, participant data collection, and secure backend storage.
projects.impact: Helped organizers streamline event-day data collection and improve reporting by digitizing survey workflows previously completed on paper.
projects.context: Developed as voluntary work for the Cancer Survivor organization to support their yearly charity initiative.
features: Mobile data entry for event participants
Backend API for securely storing responses in MongoDB
Companion frontend dashboard for monitoring submissions
Spreadsheet export functionality for annual reporting
Offline-capable installation (APK sideloading) used for PoC
projects.deployment: Manually deployed to Android devices for event use; not published to app stores.
projects.repo: Private — contains sensitive participant and survey logic
